title: Frances McDormand
summary: Frances Louise McDormand (born Cynthia Ann Smith; June 23, 1957) is an American actress and producer. Throughout her career spanning over nearly four decades, McDormand has appeared in a wide variety of projects on the screen and stage, portraying various characters for which she has frequently received acclaim.[1][2][3] She has garnered numerous accolades, including a Tony Award, two Primetime Emmy Awards, and four Academy Awards: three for her acting, and a fourth Academy Award as producer, making her one of the few performers to achieve the "Triple Crown of Acting". Additionally, she has received two Golden Globe Awards, three British Academy Film Awards, and four Screen Actors Guild Awards. Although primarily recognized for her roles in small-budget independent films, McDormand's worldwide box office gross exceeds $2.2 billion.[4]
